1.q_string: The vapour pressure of a solution in a dilute solution is influenced by:
Which of the following liquid pairs shows a positive deviation from Raoult's law?

q_option: The vapour pressure of the solution is equal to the mole fraction of the solvent.
The relative lowering of vapour pressure is equal to the mole fraction of the solute.
The relative lowering of vapour pressure is proportional to the amount of the solute.
The lowering of vapour pressure is equal to the mole fraction of the solute.
1.q_string: Which of the following statements is/are true for Raoult's law?
An azeotropic mixture of HCL and water has:

An aqueous solution freezes at \(-0.186^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\left(\mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{f}}=1.86^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\ \mathrm{kg}\ \mathrm{mol}^{-1}\right.\) and \(\mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{b}}=\) \(0.512^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\ \mathrm{kg}\ \mathrm{mol}^{-1}\) ). What is the elevation in boiling point?

A mixture of ethyl alcohol and propyl alcohol has a vapour pressure of \(290 \mathrm{~mm}\) at \(300 \mathrm{~K}\). The vapour pressure of propyl alcohol is \(200 \mathrm{~mm}\). If the mole fraction of ethyl alcohol is \(0.6\), its vapour pressure(in \(\mathrm{mm}\) ) at the same temperature will be:

q_option: They all have the same osmotic pressure.
1.q_string:
Consider seperate solutions of \(0.500 \mathrm{M}\ \mathrm{C}_{2} \mathrm{H}_{5} \mathrm{OH}(\mathrm{aq}), 0.250 \mathrm{M}\ \mathrm{KBr}(\mathrm{aq})\),

\(0.125 \mathrm{M} \ \mathrm{Na}_{3} \mathrm{PO}_{4}(\mathrm{aq})\) and \(0.1 \mathrm{M}\ \mathrm{Mg}_{3}\left(\mathrm{PO}_{4}\right)_{2}\) at \(25^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\).

Which statement is true about these solutions, assuming all salts to be strong electrolytes?

What concentration of \(\mathrm{NH}_{3}\) must be present in \(0.1 \mathrm{M A g \mathrm{NO}_{3}}\) solution to prevent \(\mathrm{AgCl}\) from precipitation when \(5.85 \mathrm{~g}\) of \(\mathrm{NaCl}\) are added to \(250 \mathrm{~mL}\) of this solution?

\(\mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{sp}(\mathrm{AgCl})}=2 \times 10^{-10} ; \quad \mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{f}}\left[\mathrm{Ag}\left(\mathrm{NH}_{3}\right)_{2}\right]^{+}=10^{7}\)

In a \(0.2\) molal aqueous solution of a weak acid \(\mathrm{HX}\), the degree of ionization is \(0.3\). Taking \(\mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{f}}\) for water as \(1.85\), the freezing point of the solution will be nearest to:

\(12 \mathrm{~g}\) of urea is present in \(1\) litre of solution and \(68.4 \mathrm{~g}\) of sucrose is separately dissolved in \(1\) litre of another sample of solution. The lowering of vapour pressure of first solution is:

What is the freezing point of a solution containing \(8.1 \mathrm{~g}\ \mathrm{HBr}\) in \(100\ \mathrm{gm}\) water assuming the acid to be \(90 \%\) ionised?

\(\left[\mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{f}}\right.\) for water \(=1.86 \mathrm{~K}\) molarity \({}^{-1}]\)
Which of the following pair will form an ideal solution?
\(18 \mathrm{~g}\) glucose is added to \(178.2 \mathrm{~g}\) of water the vapour pressure of water for this aqueous solution at \(100^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\) is:

A solution contain \(8 \mathrm{~g}\) of a carbohydrate in \(100 \mathrm{~g}\) of water has a density \(1.025 \mathrm{~g} / \mathrm{ml}\) and an osmotic pressure of \(5\) atm at \(27^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\). What is the molar mass of the carbohydrate?
Determine the Van't Hoff factor for \(\mathrm{Ca}\left(\mathrm{NO}_{3}\right)_{2}\) on complete \( (100\%)\) dissociation.
